page.title: 06FARMING 2
page.content: At some time most of the hedgerows bordering the roads have been uprooted, only ditches now separate road and farmland, but on the borders of Shopland Hall small saplings have been planted at intervals presumably to create a habitat for animals and wild plants. This particular farming company is concerned with a programme of conservation in conjunction with local schools. A variety of wild plants can be found in the ditches bordering the fields, including Charlock, Milk Parsley, Common Poppy, Fingered Speedwell, White Dead-nettle, Common Ragwort, Field Pepperwort, Red Campion, Camomile and a variety of wild grasses.
